sentences.en: But the Great Depression of 1929 - 1940 was the impetus for great union growth.
sentences.cn: 可是1929和1940年之间的大萧条成了促使工会发展的动力.

sentences.en: By 1982, she was restless and needed a new impetus for her talent.
sentences.cn: 到了1982年，她感到厌倦了，需要新的动力来激发她的才能。

sentences.en: Formalization is necessary requirement and directive impetus for design patterns.
sentences.cn: 形式化是设计模式发展的必然要求和直接推动力.

sentences.en: Her speech gave an impetus to my ideas.
sentences.cn: 她的讲话激发了我的思绪.

sentences.en: Material elements needed the impetus of intangibles of faith and dedication.
sentences.cn: 物质因素还必须由无形的信念和献身精神来推动.

sentences.en: She was restless and needed a new impetus for her talent.
sentences.cn: 她躁动不安，需要为自己的才华找到新的突破口。

sentences.en: The car ran down the hill under its own impetus.
sentences.cn: 汽车借着本身的冲力滑下山.

sentences.en: The discovery gave fresh impetus to the research.
sentences.cn: 这个发现为研究带来新动力。

sentences.en: The major impetus for agencies to make greater use of their rulemaking authority came from Congress.
sentences.cn: 行政机关在更大程度上利用它们的规则制定权的动力来自于国会.

sentences.en: The treaty gave a fresh impetus to trade.
sentences.cn: 这条约使双方的贸易又推进了一步.

sentences.en: There is a danger of the housing programme running out of steam, ie losing its impetus.
sentences.cn: 住宅兴建计画有半途而废之虞.

sentences.en: This decision will give renewed impetus to the economic regeneration of east London.
sentences.cn: 这一决定会给东伦敦的经济复苏带来新的推动力。

sentences.en: This feeling, I am sure, gives much impetus to the police.
sentences.cn: 我可以确信, 这种感觉给了警察方面很大的鼓励.

sentences.en: This is an encouragement [ impetus ] to us.
sentences.cn: 这是对我们的 鞭策.

sentences.en: This is the primary impetus behind the economic recovery.
sentences.cn: 这是促使经济复苏的主要动力.

sentences.en: We would then have to use this to give impetus to the search for peace.
sentences.cn: 我们就必须利用这一点推动对和平的探求.

trans.tran_en: an influence that makes something happen or makes it happen more quickly
